auth.rotary_account: Already have an account in My Rotary?
auth.forgot_password_title: Forgot your password? No problem. Just let us know your email address and we'll send you a password reset link that will allow you to choose a new one.

profile.title: Profile
profile.subtitle: Update profile information and account email address.
profile.name: Name
profile.update_password_description: Ensure your account is using a long, random password to stay secure.
profile.delete_account_description: Once your account is deleted, all your resources and data will be permanently deleted. Before deleting your account, download any data or information you want to keep.
profile.delete_account_warning: Are you sure you want to delete your account? Once your account is deleted, all your resources and data will be permanently deleted. Before deleting your account, download any data or information you want to keep.
profile.delete_account_warning_title: Are you sure you want to delete your account?

layout.title: Global Grant Application
layout.subtitle: All fields are mandatory unless indicated as optional.

step1.title: Step #1 General Information
step1.page_title: Provide some basic information and we'll assign a number to your request.
step1.project_type: What type of project do you plan to carry out?
step1.project_type_description: Check all options that apply, in order to determine what other data is needed.
step1.humanitarian_description: Address community needs with measurable and sustainable results.
step1.team_description: Enhance community competencies by funding the travel of a group of professionals to train their local peers or acquire new skills.
step1.beca_description: Finance postgraduate studies for individuals interested in pursuing a professional career in one of Rotary's areas of interest.
step1.contacts: Select the main contacts (local and international) of the project

modal.title: Main contacts
modal.default: You have been automatically designated as the main contact for the project. Before selecting the second one, tell us about your role and the project sponsors.
modal.second_contact_description: Who is the main international contact? Search for it in the search fields below.

step2.title: Step #2 Committee Members
step2.team: Who are the local members of the project committee?
step2.team_international: Who are the international members of the project committee?
step2.has_conflict_member: Are there any potential conflicts of interest among the committee members?

step3.title: Step #3 Project Overview
step3.page_title: Tell us about the project. What are its main objectives and who will be its beneficiaries?

step4.title: Step #4 Areas of Interest
step4.page_title: Which areas of interest does the project belong to?
step4.page_description: Select at least one area. We will ask you to set goals and answer certain questions for each area of interest you select.

peaceprev.title: PEACE AND CONFLICT PREVENTION
peaceprev.description: What goals of this area of interest does the project support?
peaceprev.description2: Select all that apply. We will ask you questions about the ones you select and, at the conclusion of the project, you will submit a report on the results achieved in each of them.
peaceprev.check1: Empower people and communities to transform conflicts and build peace.
peaceprev.check2: Train community members in fields such as education, leadership for peace, and conflict prevention and resolution.
peaceprev.check3: Provide services that contribute to integrating vulnerable groups into society.
peaceprev.check4: Improve dialogue and relationships in the community to determine the best way to manage natural resources.
peaceprev.check5: Award postgraduate scholarships for professionals in the field of peace and conflict prevention.
peaceprev.collect_info: Do you already know who will collect the necessary information for evaluation and monitoring?
peaceprev.capacity: Briefly explain why this person or organization is qualified to perform this task.
peaceprev.explain: Indicate how you will seek the person or organization that will be responsible for this task.
modalMeasures: Number of groups and organizations involved in peacebuilding efforts
Number of people trained
Number of conflicts mediated
Number of communities reporting a reduction in conflict level
Other

prevent.title: Disease Prevention and Treatment
prevent.description: What goals of this area of interest does the project support?
prevent.description2: Select all that apply. We will ask you questions about the ones you select, and at the conclusion of the project, you will submit a report on the results achieved in each of them.
prevent.check1: Improve the skills of local medical professionals.
prevent.check2: Promote prevention and treatment programs for diseases with the aim of containing the spread of communicable diseases and reducing the incidence and consequences of non-communicable diseases.
prevent.check4: Provide clinical and rehabilitation treatments to individuals with physical disabilities.
prevent.check5: Fund postgraduate scholarships for professionals working in the field of disease prevention and treatment.
prevent.collect_info: Do you already know who will collect the necessary information for evaluation and monitoring?
modalMeasures: Number of trained doctors and healthcare staff.
Number of people reporting improved quality of healthcare services.
Number of beneficiaries of disease prevention intervention.
Number of communities reporting a decrease in disease cases.
Number of healthcare facilities benefited.
Number of communities reporting increased access to healthcare facilities.
Number of health-focused events.
Number of health education campaigns.
Other

water.title: Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene
water.check1: Facilitate universal and equitable access to safe drinking water.
water.check2: Improve water quality by protecting and maintaining surface or groundwater resources, reducing pollution and contaminants, and promoting wastewater reuse.
water.check3: Facilitate universal and equitable access to improved sanitation and waste treatment services to end the practice of open defecation in communities.
water.check4: Improve community hygiene knowledge, habits, and practices to contribute to disease transmission prevention.
water.check5: Strengthen the capacity of governments, institutions, and communities to design, finance, manage, and maintain sustainable water and sanitation services.
water.check6: Fund postgraduate scholarships for professionals in fields related to water, sanitation, and hygiene.
modalMeasures: Number of people with access to improved sources of drinking water.
Number of people with access to improved sanitation facilities.
Number of people with access to disinfected water through household water treatment.
Number of communities with a functioning governance committee.
Number of communities using a tariff/usage structure.
Number of people trained.
Other

health.title: Maternal and Child Health
health.check2: Reduce the mortality and morbidity rate of children under five years old.
health.check3: Reduce the maternal mortality and morbidity rate.
health.check4: Improve access to essential medical services, trained community health workers, and healthcare service providers.
health.check5: Fund postgraduate scholarships for professionals in fields related to maternal and child health.
modalMeasures: Number of children under 5 receiving medical treatment.
Number of mothers receiving prenatal care.
Number of maternal and child health professionals trained.
Number of communities reporting a decrease in the mortality rate of children under 5.
Number of communities reporting a decrease in the morbidity rate of children under 5.
Number of communities reporting a decrease in the maternal mortality rate.
Number of communities reporting a decrease in the maternal morbidity rate.
Number of healthcare facilities benefited.
Other

education.title: Literacy and Basic Education
education.check1: Support programs aimed at strengthening communities' capacity to provide basic education and literacy to all their members.
education.check2: Increase the literacy level of adults.
education.check3: Work to reduce educational disparity between genders.
education.check4: Fund postgraduate scholarships for professionals in fields related to literacy and basic education.
modalMeasures: Number of children benefited in school age
Number of new students in school age.
Number of new female students in school age.
Number of teachers receiving adult education training.
Number of adults receiving literacy training.
Number of institutions participating in the program.
Number of adults using new literacy skills.
Number of new teaching positions created.
Other

economic.title: Community Economic Development
economic.check1: Strengthen the capacity of civic leaders, local organizations, and community networks to support economic development in impoverished communities.
economic.check2: Create opportunities for productive employment and improve access to sustainable livelihoods.
economic.check3: Empower marginalized communities by providing them access to economic services and opportunities.
economic.check4: Strengthen the capacity of entrepreneurs, social enterprises, and innovative community-based entrepreneurs.
economic.check5: Address gender or class disparities preventing affected individuals from gaining productive employment and accessing markets and financial services.
economic.check6: Improve access to renewable energy sources and adopt energy-saving measures aimed at creating sustainable and economically resilient communities.
economic.check7: Empower communities to acquire skills for environmental conservation and natural resource management so they can derive economic benefits from them.
economic.check8: Strengthen the economic resilience and adaptability capacities of communities to respond to natural disasters and risks related to the environment and climate change.
economic.check9: Develop and support basic community emergency services aimed at improving economic resilience.
economic.check10: Fund scholarships for professionals working in the area of community economic development.
modalMeasures: Number of entrepreneurs supported.
Number of businesses supported.
Number of people trained.
Number of jobs created.
Number of youth employed in income-generating activities.
Other

environment.title: Environment
environment.check1: Protect and restore terrestrial, coastal, marine, and freshwater resources.
environment.check2: Improve the capacity of communities and local governments to support the management and conservation of natural resources.
environment.check3: Support agroecology and sustainable agriculture, fishing, and aquaculture practices to improve ecological health.
environment.check4: Address the causes of climate change and climate disruption and support solutions to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
environment.check5: Strengthen the resilience of ecosystems and communities affected by climate change and climate disruption.
environment.check6: Support education to promote behaviors that protect the environment.
environment.check7: Advocate for sustainable consumption of products and environmentally sound waste management to build a more resource-efficient economy.
environment.check8: Address environmental justice issues and public health concerns related to the environment.
environment.check9: Fund scholarships for professionals in fields related to the environment
modalMeasures: Total number of direct beneficiaries.
Number of people trained.
Other

step6.title: Step #6 Venue and Dates
step6.page_title: Where will the project take place?
step6.project: When will the project take place?

step7.title: Step #7 Participants
step7.name: Name
step7.integrants: Does any committee member have a potential conflict of interest with one of the collaborating organizations?
step7.why_you_collaborate: Why did you decide to collaborate with this organization and what role will it play?
step7.project_participants: Indicate other collaborators who will participate in this project
step7.travelers_volunteers_description: Grants for humanitarian projects can fund the travel of a maximum of two people to provide training or contribute to project implementation (provided that individuals with such skills cannot be found locally). Upload a resume for each volunteer traveler. Do not include confidential personal data, such as government identification numbers, religion, race, health information, etc. You are responsible for informing volunteer travelers about the personal data you have provided about them to Rotary and that it will be processed in accordance with Rotary's
step7.participants_role: Describe the role local sponsors will play in the project:
step7.patreon_role: Describe the role international sponsors will play in the project:
step7.traveler_is_member: Is the traveling person a Rotary member?

step8.title: Step #8 Budget
step8.page_title: Indicate which currency will be used in the project budget
step8.page_description: The currency you select should be used for most project expenses.
step8.budget_description: List all items in the budget. The total budget must match the amount of funds, which will be calculated in the ninth step. Therefore, grant budgets, including the Global Fund contribution, must be at least US$30,000.

step9.title: Step #9 Funding
step9.page_title: Tell us about the funds you have secured for the project. We will use this information to calculate the maximum matching contribution you could receive from the Global Fund.
step9.add_source_description: Each time a cash contribution is made to a project funded by a Global Grant, an additional 5 percent must be added to cover the expenses associated with processing such funds. Clubs and districts will receive the Paul Harris Fellow recognition points corresponding to this additional charge.
step9.amount_project: What is the amount of Global Fund you would like to receive for this project?
step9.amount_project_description: You can request up to $0.00 from the Global Fund.
step9.amount_project_validation: The amount you requested exceeds the available amount.
step9.finantiation_resume_validation: The total funding for this project does not match the total budget.
step9.no_rotary_money: Contributions made by non-Rotary individuals not equipped by the Foundation
step9.own_money: Endowed/Directed gift - T10031 - Ernesto Leal Memorial Named Ambassadorial Scholarship

step10.title: Step #10 Sustainability
step10.page_description: Sustainable projects offer long-term solutions to the problems facing a community. For a project to be sustainable, community members must sustain project activities themselves once grant funds are exhausted. Your answers to the questions below will help us determine which elements of the project make it sustainable.
step10.nececities: Describe the community needs the project will address.
step10.process: What process was followed to determine these needs?
step10.integrants: How did members of the beneficiary community participate in seeking solutions?
step10.participation: What involvement did members of the local community have in project planning?
step10.resume_imp: Summarize each stage of project implementation.
step10.disclamer: Do not include sensitive personal data, such as government ID numbers, religion, race, health information, etc. If you include personal data, you are responsible for informing those whose personal data is included that you are providing it to Rotary and that it will be processed in accordance with Rotary’s Privacy Policy.
step10.cooperative: Will you work in coordination with other similar initiatives underway in the community?
step10.capacitation: Describe the training, education, or community outreach programs the project will encompass.
step10.determinate_necesities: What process was followed to determine the needs?
step10.incentives: What incentives (e.g., financial compensation, awards, certifications, or publicity) will be used to encourage community members to participate in the project?
step10.supervisors_names: Enter the names of community members or groups who will oversee project activities once funded activities conclude.
step10.providers: Will you use local suppliers to acquire budgeted equipment and materials?
step10.licit: Was a bidding process used to select suppliers?
step10.integ: Does any committee member have a potential conflict of interest with any of the providers?
step10.adqui: If the project includes the acquisition of equipment or materials, provide the operation and maintenance plan. The plan should indicate who will be responsible for operating and maintaining the equipment and the training they will receive
step10.community_inte: Describe how community members will maintain equipment once grant-funded activities conclude. Will spare parts be available?
step10.subvenc: If grant funds will be used to acquire equipment, will they be suitable for the community's cultural environment and technological standards?
step10.completed_project: Once the project is completed, who will own the items purchased with grant funds? No item may be owned by a district, club, or partner.
step10.credit: Does your project include microcredit activities?
step10.account: Do you have a local funding source to sustain project outcomes long-term?
step10.element: Will any project element generate income to fund the project long-term? If so, explain.
